riddles.output: What number becomes zero when you subtract 15 from half of it? Answer: 30
I am a number. When you multiply me by 3 and add 12, you get 30. What number am I? Answer: 6
I am a two-digit number. My tens digit is twice my ones digit. The sum of my digits is 9. What number am I? Answer: 63
If you add 7 to me, then divide by 2, you get 10. What number am I? Answer: 13
I am a number less than 50. When you divide me by 7, the remainder is 3. When you divide me by 5, the remainder is 2. What is the largest such number? Answer: 47

riddles.input: Challenge me with a math riddle
riddles.output: Double me and subtract 4, you get 10. What number am I? Answer: 7
I am a three-digit number. My tens digit is the sum of my hundreds and ones digit. My hundreds digit is 2 more than my ones digit. What number am I? Answer: 253

riddles.input: Can you give me a math riddle?
riddles.output: I am a number. Multiply me by 4, then subtract 6, you get 18. What number am I? Answer: 6
I am a number. If you square me and subtract 9, you get 16. What number am I? Answer: 5
What comes next in the sequence: 2, 6, 12, 20, 30, __? Answer: 42 (n^2 + n)
I am a number between 10 and 50. I am divisible by both 3 and 5. What number am I? Answer: 30
A father is 30 years older than his son. In 10 years, he will be three times his son's age. How old is the son now? Answer: 5
I am a number. If you divide me by 5 and add 7, you get 12. What number am I? Answer: 25
I am a number. If you multiply me by myself, then subtract 4, you get 21. What number am I? Answer: 5
I am a number. If you subtract me from 10, you get twice my value. What number am I? Answer: 10/3
I am an even number. If you divide me by 3, the remainder is 1. If you divide me by 5, the remainder is 4. What number am I? Answer: 16
I am a three-digit number. My tens digit is 4 more than my ones digit. My hundreds digit is 1 less than my tens digit. What number am I? Answer: 593
I am a number. If you subtract 6 from me and divide by 2, you get 7. What number am I? Answer: 20
I am a number. If you add my digits together, you get 12. If you reverse my digits, I am still the same number. What number am I? Answer: 66
I am a number. If you multiply me by 4 and subtract 10, you get 50. What number am I? Answer: 15
I am a number. If you multiply me by myself, you get 49. What number am I? Answer: 7
What comes next: 1, 4, 9, 16, 25, __? Answer: 36 (n^2)
I am a number. If you divide me by 7, the remainder is 4. If you divide me by 5, the remainder is 2. What is the smallest such number? Answer: 19
I am a number. If you double me and add 8, you get 20. What number am I? Answer: 6
I follow the pattern: 3, 6, 12, 24, 48, __? Answer: 96 (each term Ã—2)
I am a number. If you add 5 to me, then double the result, you get 30. What number am I? Answer: 10
I am a number. If you subtract 9 from me, you get 4 times my original value. What number am I? Answer: 3
I am a number. If you multiply me by 5, you get 35. What number am I? Answer: 7
